title: 05. Augustus and Religion
description: Augustus’ use of traditional and new religious practices to legitimise and reinforce his authority.

questions.question: What was Augustus’ overall approach to religion during his reign?
options: Revival and restoration of traditional religion
Replacement of Roman religion with emperor worship

questions.question: How did Augustus use priestly colleges to strengthen his authority?
options: By becoming a member of each college
By placing them under Senate control

questions.question: Which position gave Augustus ultimate authority over Roman religion from 12 BCE?
What does the revival of festivals such as the Lupercalia suggest about Augustus’ aims?
Why did Augustus build temples to gods such as Mars and Divine Julius?
options: To emphasise his divine ancestry and achievements

questions.question: How did Augustus link himself to the worship of the Lares?
options: By associating his Genius with them
By replacing them with foreign gods
By moving their shrines to temples

questions.question: What does Augustus’ encouragement of Lares worship indicate about his religious policy?
Which new deities were formalised during Augustus’ reign?
How did Augustus associate himself with these new deities?
options: By attaching his name to them

questions.question: Which poet refers to Augustus in divine terms?
What discrepancy exists in sources regarding temple restoration?
Which source claims Augustus restored 82 temples?
How did Virgil differ in his account of temple restoration?
options: He gave a much higher figure

questions.question: How did Augustus treat foreign cults within Rome?
options: He replaced Roman cults with them

questions.question: Which foreign cults were banned in Rome under Augustus?
What does Augustus’ tolerance of Jewish practices suggest?
options: Selective tolerance based on political stability

questions.question: What does Augustus’ initiation into the Eleusinian Mysteries demonstrate?
options: Willingness to engage with respected Greek cults
